summary: This is an internal email from July 2, 2020, forwarding a Reuters news article about the arrest of Ghislaine Maxwell by the FBI on Epstein-related charges. The email includes a brief note about notifying OPA and contains the full text of the news report detailing Maxwell's arrest, her background, and the context of Epstein's prior arrest and death.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: British socialite and heiress arrested by the FBI on Epstein-related charges; accused of helping Epstein groom teen girls for sex.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Financier who was arrested on federal charges of exploiting underage girls; died by suicide in custody in 2019; Maxwell was his confidante and former girlfriend.

persons.name: Robert Maxwell
persons.role: Media baron, father of Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Mentioned as the father of Ghislaine Maxwell.

persons.name: Jonathan Dienst
persons.context: Co-author of the Reuters news article about Ghislaine Maxwell's arrest.

persons.name: Joe Valiquette
persons.context: Co-author of the Reuters news article about Ghislaine Maxwell's arrest.

persons.name: Tom Winter
persons.context: Co-author of the Reuters news article about Ghislaine Maxwell's arrest.

persons.name: Sarah Fitzpatrick
persons.context: Co-author of the Reuters news article about Ghislaine Maxwell's arrest.

connections.description: Maxwell was Epstein's confidante, former girlfriend, and accused of helping him groom teen girls for sex.
Robert Maxwell is the father of Ghislaine Maxwell.

events.title: Arrest of Ghislaine Maxwell
events.description: Ghislaine Maxwell was arrested by the FBI on the East Coast on Epstein-related charges and was expected to appear in federal court.

events.title: Death of Jeffrey Epstein
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein died by suicide in custody after a second suicide attempt in early August 2019.

events.title: Arrest of Jeffrey Epstein
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein was arrested last summer on federal charges of exploiting dozens of underage girls in New York and Florida in the early 2000s.

events.title: Deposition transcript release
events.description: A federal appeals court released the transcript of a 2016 deposition in which Epstein repeatedly refused to say whether Maxwell had procured young girls for him.

events.title: Defamation suit against Maxwell
events.description: One of the teens leveled charges against Maxwell in a 2015 defamation suit, alleging she helped Epstein groom teen girls for sex.

keyFacts: Ghislaine Maxwell was arrested by the FBI on July 2, 2020, on Epstein-related charges.
Maxwell was accused in a civil suit of allegedly helping Epstein traffic underage girls and groom teen girls for sex with the rich and powerful.
Jeffrey Epstein died by suicide in custody in August 2019 after being arrested on federal charges of exploiting dozens of underage girls.
Two guards tasked with monitoring Epstein face federal charges for not properly supervising him before his death.
A 2016 deposition transcript showed Epstein repeatedly refused to say whether Maxwell had procured young girls for him.
